summary: The SECURE Act (S. 2106) proposes a pathway to lawful permanent resident status for certain foreign nationals from countries designated under section 244(b) (Temporary Protected Status). It outlines eligibility criteria, including continuous presence in the U.S., passing background checks, and specific exclusions. The bill also addresses application fees, waivers, confidentiality of information, and reporting requirements for terminating temporary protected status designations.  It also makes amends on other related parts to immigration.
